com.adaptinet.pluginagent
Class Plugin

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.adaptinet.pluginagent.PluginRoot
        |
        +--com.adaptinet.pluginagent.Plugin
Direct Known Subclasses:
Console
public abstract class Plugin
extends PluginRoot

The Plugin class is an abstract class from which all client plugins must derive.

Fields inherited from class com.adaptinet.pluginagent.PluginRoot

Constructor Detail

Plugin

public Plugin()
Method Detail

init

public abstract void init()
Gives a plugin a chance to do one time initialization. Method is called when the plugin is first loaded.
Overrides:
init in class PluginRoot

cleanup

public abstract void cleanup()
Gives a plugin a chance to cleanup any outstanding resources this plugin may be holding. Method is called just before it is unloaded.
Overrides:
cleanup in class PluginRoot

unload

public void unload()
This method will unload this plugin.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
This method will shutdown the Transceiver.

error

public void error(java.lang.String uri,
                  java.lang.String errorMsg)
This method allows the another entity to post an error message to the plugin. The source of the message could be a local failure or from a remote request.
Parameters:
uri - This is the uri of the message when the fault was caused.
errorMsg - This is the message indicating the particular fault.

peerUpdate

public void peerUpdate()
This method is for notification of plugins that the status of the peers has changed

preProcessMessage

public boolean preProcessMessage(Envelope env)
Gives a plugin an opportunity to do any message preprocessing that may be required.
Parameters:
env - Envelope of message
Returns:
true if preprocessing was successful and the message is ready to be delivered. false if preprocessing failed and message delivery should not be attempted.

peekMessage

public final Envelope peekMessage(boolean bRemove)
Checks this plugin's message queue for available messages.
Parameters:
bRemove - Indicates whether the message should be removed from the queue.
Returns:
Envelope of available message or null if no message is available

getPeers

public final java.util.Iterator getPeers(boolean all)
This retreives the list of peers being maintained by the peer tobology.
Parameters:
bAll - Indicates whether all the peers should be returned, or only the peers that are directley connected
Returns:
Iterator of the peers requested null if there are no peers connected
